name: combinatorially

in a way that relates to the arrangement of a number of elements from a set without putting them in any particular order: These variations, whose number may explode combinatorially, must be considered in network optimization applications. A combinatorially significant intersection between edges is highlighted with a small grey box.
More examplesFewer examplesIt is important to find combinatorially defined operators that produce sets of rotation pairs with this property.Multi-protein complexes are often combinatorially assembled from a selection of possible subunits in the cell.
